description: Enable to ensure that the request will not delete or modify any existing Asset Pooling Rules.

Asset_Pooling_Rule_Replacement_Data.description: This is a unique reference identifier to the set of asset pooling rules.
Used to define the order of the rules (ascending).

OrganizationObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

OrganizationObjectID.type: WID,  Company_Reference_ID,  Cost_Center_Reference_ID,  Custom_Organization_Reference_ID,  Organization_Reference_ID,  Region_Reference_ID
OrganizationObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

OrganizationObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Asset_Pooling_Rule_Replacement_Data.description: Reference to existing companies or company hierarchies to which the asset pooling rule applies.

validation.validation: One or more companies for a rule for Spend Category ([spend category]) have a company currency that does not match the currency specified.

Spend_Category_or_HierarchyObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Spend_Category_or_HierarchyObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Spend_Category_or_HierarchyObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Asset_Pooling_Rule_Replacement_Data.description: Reference to existing spend categories or spend category hierarchies to which the asset pooling rule applies.

validation.validation: Invalid Spend Category. This spend category cannot be tracked in Business Assets

Item_DescriptorObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Item_DescriptorObjectID.type: WID,  Catalog_Item_ID,  Catalog_Load_Item_ID,  Expense_Item_ID,  Purchase_Item_ID,  Sales_Item_ID,  Supplier_Item_ID
Item_DescriptorObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Item_DescriptorObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Asset_Pooling_Rule_Replacement_Data.description: Reference to existing item to which the asset pooling rule applies.

validation.validation: One or more items is invalid because it does not belong to a trackable Spend Category.

CurrencyObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

CurrencyObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

CurrencyObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Asset_Pooling_Rule_Replacement_Data.description: Reference to an existing currency to which the asset pooling rule applies. This is required if Less Than Amount is specified.

validation.validation: Currency is required when Unit Cost Less Than is specified.

Asset_Pooling_Rule_Replacement_Data.description: The quantity above which the asset pooling rule applies. Quantity must be greater than zero.

validation.validation: Quantity must be greater than zero.
The amount entered has too many digits beyond the decimal point.

Asset_Pooling_Rule_Replacement_Data.description: The amount below which the asset pooling rule applies.

Asset_Pooling_Rule_Data.description: Element containing asset pooling rule replacement data.

validation.validation: Either Spend Category or Item must be specified.
Use another ID for the Asset Pooling Rule or unset the Add Only attribute. An Asset Pooling Rule Rule already exists for the ID [ID].
validation.description: The Put Asset Pooling Rule web service cannot be used to edit an existing rule; it can only add rules, or replace all rules.

description: Element containing all Asset Pooling Rules
